geninfo.para: Complaints have been received about a "knocking" or "ticking" noise coming from the front of the Cummins N14 engines equipped with a Horton on/off fan clutch. The noise is detected only when the vehicle is not moving, engine is running at low idle speed and the fan clutch is not engaged. Only a very small fraction of the total population has reported this phenomenon.
Descriptions of this "noise" vary and often it cannot be recognized by second parties.
We believe the cause is the fan clutch/fan reacting to an engine vibration that is in the natural frequency range of the fan clutch.
Of these "noise" investigated to date, there is no reason to believe that damage to the engine or fan clutch will result.
When this noise is encountered, costly tear down, replacing parts or making other efforts to repair should not be undertaken.
